query: Chronologically trace all communications about delays.
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: Chronologically trace all communications about delays.

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[Patrick Stockton Outline #1.docx, p.1]
St. Louis staff and the owner’s representative expressed ongoing frustration with lack of communication from support functions—including delays traced to Savannah (GAC0036234, GAC0045317).

[Joe Schuster Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Were you aware of issues like lost traceability, paint mismatches, and missed warranty review on outsourced parts? (Farnham p. 13; PHB p. 17).

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.19]
Engine Mount Issue - Traceability and Replacement:9 The engine mount issue, involving

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.19]
corrosion findings, shipment to Gulfstream Savannah, loss of traceability, and the initial

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.22]
Savannah for corrosion removal and evaluation. This resulted in delays, loss of traceability for

[Mike Brown (FAZ) Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
Theme: The damages claimed are based on industry-standard, cautious assumptions and directly traceable to Gulfstream’s extended delays.

[Mike Brown (FAZ) Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
A. Yes. All assumptions and methodologies are stated clearly in the report, and the underlying calculations are traceable.

[3. Mike Brown (FAZ) Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
Are your calculations traceable from underlying records?

[3. Mike Brown (FAZ) Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
Q: Can the tribunal trace each number in your report back to its source?

[WFW Restructured - D. Farnham Expert Report.docx, p.1]
Engine Mount Issue - Traceability and Replacement: The engine mount issue, involving corrosion findings, shipment to Savannah, loss of traceability, and the initial attempt to charge for used replacements, highlights inefficiencies in parts handling, communication, and problem-solving related to technical issues. The eventual resolution (no-charge replacement) only came after significant delays and expert intervention.

[2. Craig Kleebe - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Scope: Klebe oversaw proposal quoting processes, including the cost and downtime estimates provided to CITIOM for the 192-month inspection. His internal communications reveal knowledge of systemic underestimation and failure to apply updated forecasting tools. His testimony is central to CITIOM’s misrepresentation claims and spoliation arguments.

[2. Craig Kleebe - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Present Gulfstream’s internal communications during that window showing increasing internal awareness of risk

[111-206.pdf, p.12]
one of the other parties was involved or directing communications?

[111-206.pdf, p.15]
parties was involved or directing communications?
